lang_sim: I could easily translate some of the sentences because the Old French was very similar to modern French. My Latin did not help as much, but I did see many more of the Latin roots of French words in Old French than I typically see in modern French.
memorable: I really liked the detail of the rooms in the game. They seemed very thought out.
stereotype: I only played the Queen's module, so none that I saw. I did find it interesting that Brendan was addressing the Queen rather than the King though.
frustration: The mouse/look around feature kept glitching on my computer. Sometimes my mouse would leave the playing screen and hit my normal computer screen, other times the mouse/look around feature just wouldn't work.
enjoyable: I loved that you could listen to the Anglo-Norman French pronunciation. I felt like this made the experience more memorable and like I could actually learn some of the language rather than trying to think of how it might be pronounced. It was super helpful, especially as an audible learner.

lang_sim: Based on my experience with modern French, I felt like much of the vocabulary was intelligible, even if the words were changed slightly in spelling and pronunciation. Also, the sentence construction was easy to follow and was similar to others I'd experienced.
memorable: The in-game assets were extremely detailed and I felt like the model for Windsor Castle and the exterior of the building was immersive and of high quality.
stereotype: The queen certainly changed my perspective, as I expected a completely male-dominated governance structure.
frustration: Sometimes it was frustrating to walk across the large hall repeatedly. Introducing a sprint function (when double-tapping the W key) could significantly speed up gameplay. Also, including a mini-map or pointers to the next task could alleviate some needless wandering.
enjoyable: Using the codex was very intuitive and satisfying. The UI and user interactions with clickspots was intuitive and felt natural.

lang_sim: The sentence structure was very familiar. On top of this, there were many other words with the same meaning + spelling in French. Most other words had the same or similar sounds in French, but a different spelling (almost phonetic).
memorable: The most memorable aspect for me was the visuals and sound effects.
frustration: The must frustrating aspect was navigating turning around and moving at the same time - it was often a little laggy.
enjoyable: I found the visuals and sound effects the most appealing, as well as the story formulated around the vocabulary.

lang_sim: the conjugations and tenses of words were unfamiliar to me
memorable: I liked the image of the queen being very far away at the beginning
frustration: I couldn't figure out how to jump up the starts or overthe wheelbarrows so I felt stuck
enjoyable: moving around using left and right keys

lang_sim: There were main word cognates that were similar and some structures similar to french such as J'ai and Je suis, instead they used Jo for I and then add the verb.
memorable: One thing that stood out to me was the setting and the voice actors. I like that they would say the message first and then you went on the search to find words.
stereotype: The game kind of changed my perspective of how things were during the medieval times. I think we often think of this era in the context of war but this shows peaceful exchanges with different nations.
frustration: I wish there was a save progress function. I had to restart many time due to connection issues but if i could go where I left off it would've been helpful. Another thing that was frustrating was sometimes it was hard to find the cursor to change the field of view so you could get stuck in the game process.
enjoyable: I like the realism aspect of the whole game, it was simple but historically accurate. It really got into the perspective of what it could have been like as a scribe during that era. I think that is a portion of history that isn't often explored.
feedback: Overall I really enjoyed the modules, it would have loved this game as part of practice in some of my french language learning classes during my freshman and sophomore year.

lang_sim: I was able to decipher what a lot of the verbs were, even though their spellings and conjugations differed
memorable: The visuals were incredible! The setup, colors, and objects in view were intentional and incredibly well done.
stereotype: I didn't know much about medieval cultures before playing, so I'm not sure I can answer that question fairly. I definitely learned more by playing though!
frustration: I am easily frustrated when playing games that don't have explicit directions, so I wish there were clues or indicators that would tell you if you were getting close to certain objects that would move the story forward
enjoyable: The visuals and being able to make connections between the words in the story and my previous French knowledge were my favorite parts.

memorable: The queen in the first chapter

lang_sim: Many of the words of spoken and written Old French were similar to modern French (the word for queen was similar), and while the pronunciation was different I recognized many spellings and sounds.
memorable: I noticed and remembered the detail with the scrolls on the table.
stereotype: Yes, the similarity to modern language was a challenged stereotype, I had assumed that the language was very different with little to no similarities.
frustration: It was difficult to keep track of my mouse, and sometimes the computer did not respond to the key commands I put in.
enjoyable: I enjoyed being able to locate the next steps through the floating indicators.
readinfl: I have read the story, but not for this purpose and not within the last 6 months.

lang_sim: The writing seems similar to modern French
memorable: its visuel and how real the game looks
frustration: I don't play games, so I found it had to play the game, and it took me a long time to figure it out.

lang_sim: Reine, ovre, mil, and lei divine are very similar to the words in spanish like Reina, obra,and  lei divina. Some verbs are also somilar to modern french like avoir when she says J'ai. Also the passe compose is present.
memorable: The scrolls on the table were very interesting to me and I thought they would be a bigger part of the story.
frustration: I had a bit of trouble walking around the game and I had to have my mouse in a specific spot to be able to select the words marked.
enjoyable: I enjoyed the audio of the game because it provides a clear understanding of how it would have sounded back then.
feedback: I only did the first module but it is not as exciting as the introductory module and I would say I wish there were more visual aspects inside of the room so that the search for the words is funner.
